newsitem.title: THAILAND: More mergers seen among Thai finance companies.
newsitem.headline: More mergers seen among Thai finance companies.

text.p: More mergers are expect among Thai finance companies in the near future as competition intensifies, making it necessary for firms to have a larger capital base, a central bank official said on Friday.
"It is certain that the number of finance companies will decrease through the mergers," the Bank of Thailand's deputy governor Jaroong Nookhwun told a seminar.

"The mergers among them will help boost competitiveness in preparation for fiercer competiton following the liberalisation of the financial market," he added. Thailand currently has 91 operating finance and finance and securities companies.
The central bank last month launched a package of incentives including the granting of new bank licenses to promote mergers among weak finance and securities companies.
The move followed a massive revamp of the troubled and liquidity-hit finance sector in March by the Thai authorities.

Jaroong said finance companies will need to have a bigger capital base to compete with increasing foreign participation in the local financial market. "The central bank wants finance companies to have large capital base. The best way now is to trigger more mergers which will automatically increase their capital," he said. -- Bangkok newsroom (662) 652-0642
